Description: Much of North Ionian pottery plate, reconstructed from some twenty fragments; underside reserved, with dedicatory graffito. White slip on inside. Maeander band on top of rim. Palmette, volute and leaf complex at centre of floor with secondary frieze of metopal linear ornament around; main outer frieze of animals, lions, goose, boar preserved, proceeding right in thick filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 65, no. 771, pl. XXI, no. 771)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 242, no. 5)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (no. 422, pl.32.1-2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.747)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 730, pl. 99) (taken as Chian)
